definition: "hand" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 64), occurring in 提, 把, 打 etc

sentences.english: Spread some flour on the table and roll the pastry out very thin .
sentences.chinese: 在桌子上撒些面粉把馅饼皮擀得很薄。

sentences.english: For another thing, using the rolling pin make the dough round and thin.
sentences.chinese: 接下来，用擀面棍把面团擀成圆的薄饼。

sentences.english: The dough is so wet that it won't roll.
Roll the pasta out as thinly as possible.
sentences.chinese: 把面团擀开，擀得越薄越好。

sentences.english: At one point he's using two hands, as if he's rolling out pasta.
sentences.chinese: 有一会儿他用双手揉着，好像在擀面团。

sentences.english: So I confessed the story of the rolling pin.
sentences.chinese: 于是我讲述了擀面棍的故事。

sentences.english: I rolled as best I could, breaking into a sweat even though the air conditioner was going.
sentences.chinese: 我使尽全力擀得好些，于是开着空调竟还出了一身汗。

sentences.english: For the tartlet base, roll out the dough to about 3mm thickness and line buttered tartlet molds.
sentences.chinese: 将生面团擀至3毫米厚，用模具按压出形状。

sentences.english: She rolled the dough out very thin.
These doughs can be rolled out while you wait for the pastry to chill.
sentences.chinese: 在等油酥糕饼凉的时候，可以把这些面团擀薄些。

sentences.english: Again, that is, rolling must be rolling thin skin .
sentences.chinese: 再有，就是擀皮一定要擀薄。

sentences.english: The total thickness of four points is about the thickness of the center dough.
sentences.chinese: 擀出后四片状叠起来的厚度和中心大概相等。

sentences.english: She rolled out the flour and water mixture to make bread.
sentences.chinese: 她把面粉和水和成的面团擀好来做面包。

sentences.english: Making dumpling wraps is not that hard.
sentences.chinese: 又做饺子啦，这次是自己擀的饺子皮。

definition: piece of dough cut to the right size (for making jiaozi etc)
to let the dough rest (after mixing it)
maltose syrup/molasses/heavy (eyelids)/drowsy-eyed/listless/(of dough, candy etc) to soften/to become soft and sticky
to let the dough rest (after mixing it)
